title: Regulation, including the deputy commissioner, subject to the modifications set
heading: 1. The Commission for Railway Regulation, in exercise of the powers
text_raw:
1. The Commission for Railway Regulation, in exercise of the powers 
conferred on it by section 23 of the Railway Safety Act 2005 (No. 31 of 2005) 
(as amended by S.I. No. 69 of 2016), with the approval of the Minister for 
Transport and the consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure, NDP Delivery 
and Reform, hereby adopt the Rules For Pre-Existing Public Service Pension 
Scheme Members set out in S.I. No. 582 of 2014 for the purposes of the making 
of a Superannuation Scheme for staff of the Commission for Railway 
Regulation, including the deputy commissioner, subject to the modifications set 
out in Article 5.

title: Regulation, including the deputy commissioner, subject to the modifications set
heading: In accordance with section 23(8) of the Railway Safety Act 2005,
text_raw:
4. 

In accordance with section 23(8) of the Railway Safety Act 2005, 
superannuation benefits granted under this scheme to persons who immediately 
before the 1st day of January 2006 were officers of the Minister for Transport 
and the terms and conditions relating to those benefits shall not be less 
favourable to those persons than those to which they were entitled immediately 
before that day.

title: Regulation, including the deputy commissioner, subject to the modifications set
heading: 5. The modifications referred to in Article 1 are as follows:
text_raw:
5. The modifications referred to in Article 1 are as follows: 

(a) 

In Article 5 (2) (b), - 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 65 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 70 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

(b) 

In Article 5 (5), - 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 65” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 70.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 16th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [407] 3 

(c) 

In Article 7(3) – 

“5% of pensionable remuneration or,” is deleted. 

(d) 

In Article 29 (3) – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a 
pension, other than a pension based on Article 18 (Cost Neutral 
Early Retirement), a preserved pension or a pension awarded on 
medical grounds” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a 
pension, other than a pension based on Article 17 (Cost Neutral 
Early Retirement), a preserved pension or a pension awarded on 
medical grounds” 

 
 
 
 
 4 [407]
